item.title: Neo humanoid maker 1X releases world model to help bots learn what they see
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: 1X released a new world model that it says is a solid step toward its robots being able to teach themselves new tasks.

item.title: ElevenLabs CEO says the voice AI startup crossed $330M ARR last year
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The company said it took only five months to go from $200 million to $330 million in annual recurring revenue.

item.title: Apple launches ‘Creator Studio’ bundle of apps for $12.99 per month
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The bundle includes access to Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, and Pixelmator Pro on Mac and iPad, as well as Motion, Compressor, and MainStage on Mac.

item.title: Deepgram raises $130M at $1.3B valuation and buys a YC AI startup
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Deepgram is raising its Series C round at a $1.3 billion valuation.

item.title: Slackbot is an AI agent now
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Salesforce unveils Slackbot, a new AI agent that allows users to complete tasks across multiple enterprise applications from Slack.

item.title: Brazil orders Meta to suspend policy banning third-party AI chatbots from WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Brazil's competition watchdog has ordered WhatsApp to put on hold its policy that bars third-party AI companies from using its business API to offer chatbots on the app. The agency has also started an investigation against the company to determine if the policy is anti-competitive.

item.title: Converge Bio raises $25M, backed by Bessemer and execs from Meta, OpenAI, Wiz
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: AI drug discovery startup Converge Bio raised $25 million in a Series A led by Bessemer Venture Partners, with additional backing from executives at Meta, OpenAI, and Wiz.

item.title: Meta-backed Hupo finds growth after pivot to AI sales coaching from mental wellness
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Hupo’s approach to sales coaching is less about replacing human judgment and more about helping people in the moments that really matter in banking, insurance, and financial services.

item.title: Hands-on with Bee, Amazon’s latest AI wearable
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: We tried Amazon's new AI wearable Bee. It's not for pro users yet, but more features are expected this year.

item.title: Why Amazon bought Bee, an AI wearable
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Amazon explains where its wearable Bee fits in and whether it will merge with Alexa.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Meta is launching its own AI infrastructure initiative
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Meta is ramping up its efforts to build out its AI capacity — Zuckerberg said the company intended to drastically expand its energy footprint in the coming years.

item.title: Anthropic announces Claude for Healthcare following OpenAI’s ChatGPT Health reveal
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Anthropic's Claude for Healthcare is unveiled about a week after OpenAI announced its ChatGPT Health product.

item.title: Anthropic’s new Cowork tool offers Claude Code without the code
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Built into the Claude Desktop app, Cowork lets users designate a specific folder where Claude can read or modify files, with further instructions given through the standard chat interface.

item.title: Amazon says 97% of its devices can support Alexa+
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Amazon is counting on its Alexa footprint to help it gain traction in the consumer AI race.

item.title: Google’s Gemini to power Apple’s AI features like Siri
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Apple and Google have embarked on a non-exclusive, multi-year partnership that will involve Apple using Gemini models and Google cloud technology for future foundational models.

item.title: A New Jersey lawsuit shows how hard it is to fight deepfake porn
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: A number of US laws have already banned deepfake pornography — most notably the Take It Down Act. But while specific users are clearly breaking those laws, it’s much harder to hold the entire platform accountable.

item.title: Harmattan AI raises $200M Series B led by Dassault Aviation, becomes defense unicorn
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: French defense tech company Harmattan AI is now valued at $1.4 billion after raising a $200 million Series B round led by Dassault Aviation, which is best known for making the Rafale fighter jet.

item.title: Motional puts AI at center of robotaxi reboot as it targets 2026 for driverless service
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Motional says it will launch a driverless robotaxi service in Las Vegas before the end of 2026.

item.title: Google removes AI Overviews for certain medical queries
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: This follows an investigation by The Guardian that found Google AI Overviews offering misleading information in response to some health-related queries.

item.title: Indonesia and Malaysia block Grok over nonconsensual, sexualized deepfakes
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: These are the most aggressive moves so far from government officials responding to a flood of sexualized, AI-generated imagery — often depicting real women and minors, and sometimes depicting violence — posted by Grok.
